summary: The memorandum details the outcomes of the Assassination Records Review Board (ARRB) meeting on 17 November 1997, under the President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992. It covers decisions on the release, reconsideration, and classification of documents related to the JFK assassination, including CIA records, Cuban Revolutionary Council financial records, and others. The document also explains the process for reconsideration and appeals by the Agency.
key_findings: Reconsideration of the release of CIA Records Center documents was postponed until 2017.
The Board released documents related to CUA use of state cover, affecting 16 documents.
The release date of Nosenko NBR records was moved from 2017 to 2010.
Only specific financial records of the Cuban Revolutionary Council were processed as Assassination Records, with the rest declared NBR.
Parts of the Ramparts Damage Assessment Document were processed as assassination records, focusing on the International Rescue Committee's aid to Oswald.
The Board protected book cable dissemination lists in full.
Document # 104-10072-10232 was not fully protected as requested by the Agency.
Decisions on 204 additional documents were accepted based on Agency and ARRB staff recommendations.
